statements.name: PROC NETDRAW
statements.description: The NETDRAW procedure draws a network diagram of the activities in a project. Boxes (or nodes) are used to represent the activities, and lines (or arcs) are used to show the precedence relationships among the activities.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies the input data set that contains the appropriate annotate variables for the purpose of adding text and graphics to the network diagram.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Names the SAS data set to be used by PROC NETDRAW for producing a network diagram.

arguments.name: FULLSCREEN
arguments.description: Indicates that the network be drawn in full-screen mode. This enables you to view the network diagram produced by NETDRAW in different scales; you can also move nodes around the diagram to modify the layout.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the graphics catalog used to save the output produced by PROC NETDRAW for later replay.

arguments.name: GRAPHICS
arguments.description: Indicates that the network diagram produced be of high-resolution quality. If you specify the GRAPHICS option, but you do not have SAS/GRAPH software licensed at your site, the procedure stops and issues an error message. GRAPHICS is the default mode.

arguments.name: IMAGEMAP=
arguments.description: Names the SAS data set that receives a description of the areas of a graph and a link for each area. This information is for the construction of HTML image maps.

arguments.name: LINEPRINTER
arguments.description: Produces a network diagram of line-printer quality.

arguments.name: NODISPLAY
arguments.description: Requests the procedure not to display any output. The procedure still produces the Layout data set containing the details about the network layout.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the output data set produced by PROC NETDRAW. This data set, also referred to as the Layout data set, contains the node and arc placement information determined by PROC NETDRAW to draw the network.

statements.name: ACTNET
statements.description: The ACTNET statement draws the network diagram. You can specify several options in this statement to control the appearance of the network.

arguments.name: ACTIVITY=
arguments.description: Specifies the variable in the Network data set that names the nodes in the network. If the data set contains a variable called _FROM_, this specification is ignored; otherwise, this option is required.

arguments.name: ALIGN=
arguments.description: Specifies the variable in the Network data set containing the time values to be used for positioning each activity.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies the input data set that contains the appropriate annotate variables for the purpose of adding text and graphics to the network diagram.

arguments.name: ARROWHEAD=
arguments.description: Specifies the length of the arrowhead in character cell positions. You can specify ARROWHEAD=0 to suppress arrowheads altogether. The default value is 1.

arguments.name: AUTOREF
arguments.description: Draws reference lines at every tick mark. This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: AUTOZONE
arguments.description: Enables automatic zoning (or dividing) of the network into connected components.

arguments.name: BOXHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of the box (in character cell positions) used for denoting a node.

arguments.name: BOXWIDTH=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the box (in character cell positions) used for denoting a node.

arguments.name: BREAKCYCLE
arguments.description: Breaks cycles by reversing the back arcs of the network.

arguments.name: BRKCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used for drawing the zigzag break lines down the chart at break points of the time axis. The default value is >. This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: CARCS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the connecting lines (or arcs) between the nodes. The default value of this option is CYAN.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the time axis. The default value is WHITE. This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: CCNODEFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the fill color for all critical nodes of the network diagram.

arguments.name: CCRITARCS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of arcs connecting critical activities.

arguments.name: CCRITOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the outline color for critical nodes. The default value for this option is the value of the COUTLINE= option, if it is specified; otherwise, it is the same as the pattern color for the node.

arguments.name: CENTERID
arguments.description: Centers the ID values placed within each node. By default, character valued ID variables are left justified and numeric ID variables are right justified within each node. This option centers the ID values within each node.

arguments.name: CENTERSUBTREE
arguments.description: Positions each node at the center of the subtree that originates from that node instead of placing it at the midpoint of its children (which is the default behavior).

arguments.name: CHILDORDER=
arguments.description: Orders the children of each node when the network is laid out using either the TREE or the SPANNINGTREE option.

arguments.name: TOPDOWN
arguments.description: Top to bottom order.

arguments.name: BOTTOMUP
arguments.description: Bottom to top order.

arguments.name: LEFTRGHT
arguments.description: Left to right order.

arguments.name: RGHTLEFT
arguments.description: Right to left order.

arguments.name: CNODEFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the fill color for all nodes of the network diagram.

arguments.name: COMPRESS
arguments.description: Draws the network on one physical page.

arguments.name: COUTLINE=
arguments.description: Specifies an outline color for all nodes.

arguments.name: CREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the reference lines. The default value is WHITE. This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: CREFBRK=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the lines drawn to denote breaks in the time axis. The default value is WHITE. This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of all text on the network diagram including variable names or labels, values of ID variables, and so on.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specifies a descriptive string, up to 40 characters in length, that appears in the description field of the master menu in PROC GREPLAY.

arguments.name: DP
arguments.description: Causes PROC NETDRAW to use a dynamic programming (DP) algorithm to route the arcs. This DP algorithm is memory and CPU-intensive and is not necessary for most applications.

arguments.name: DURATION=
arguments.description: Specifies a variable that contains the duration of each activity in the network. This value is used only for displaying the durations of each activity within the node.

arguments.name: FILLPAGE
arguments.description: Causes the diagram on each page to be magnified (if necessary) to fill up the page.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies the font of the text.

arguments.name: FORMCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the characters used for node outlines and arcs.

arguments.name: FRAME
arguments.description: Encloses the drawing area with a border. This option is valid only for time-scaled or zoned network diagrams.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies that the height for all text in PROC NETDRAW (excluding the titles and footnotes) be h times the value of the global HTEXT= option, which is the default text height specified in the GOPTIONS statement of SAS/GRAPH. The value of h must be a positive real number; the default value is 1.0.

arguments.name: HMARGIN=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of a horizontal margin (in number of character cell positions) for the network in graphics mode. The default width is 1.

arguments.name: HPAGES=
arguments.description: Specifies that the network diagram is to be produced using h horizontal pages.

arguments.name: HTRACKS=
arguments.description: Controls the number of arcs that are drawn horizontally through the space between two adjacent nodes.

arguments.name: ID=
arguments.description: Specifies the variables in the Network data set that are displayed within each node.

arguments.name: LAG=
arguments.description: Specifies the variables in the Network data set that identify the lag types of the precedence relationships between an activity and its successors.

arguments.name: LINEAR
arguments.description: Plots one column for every mininterval between the minimum and maximum values of the ALIGN= variable.

arguments.name: LREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the linestyle (1-46) of the reference lines. The default linestyle is 1, a solid line. This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: LREFBRK=
arguments.description: Specifies the linestyle (1-46) of the zigzag break lines. The default linestyle is 1, a solid line. This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: LWCRIT=
arguments.description: Specifies the line width for critical arcs and the node outlines for critical activities.

arguments.name: LWIDTH=
arguments.description: Specifies the line width of the arcs and node outlines. The default line width is 1.

arguments.name: LWOUTLINE=
arguments.description: Specifies the line width of the node outlines.

arguments.name: MAXNULLCOLUMN=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of empty columns between two consecutive nonempty columns. The default value for this option is 0.

arguments.name: MININTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the smallest interval to be used per column of the network diagram.
arguments.help: MININTERVAL=DAY | HOUR | MONTH | SECOND | MINUTE | QTR | YEAR | WEEK

arguments.name: DAY
arguments.description: DAY

arguments.name: HOUR
arguments.description: HOUR

arguments.name: MONTH
arguments.description: MONTH

arguments.name: SECOND
arguments.description: SECOND

arguments.name: MINUTE
arguments.description: MINUTE

arguments.name: QTR
arguments.description: QUARTER

arguments.name: YEAR
arguments.description: YEAR

arguments.name: WEEK
arguments.description: WEEK

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a string of up to eight characters that appears in the name field of the catalog entry for the graph. The default name is NETDRAW.

arguments.name: NLEVELSPERCOLUMN=
arguments.description: Contracts the time axis by specifying that activities that differ in ALIGN= value by less than npercol units of MININTERVAL can be plotted in the same column. The default value of npercol is 1.

arguments.name: NOARROWFILL
arguments.description: Draws arrowheads that are not filled. By default, the procedure uses filled arrowheads.

arguments.name: NODEFID
arguments.description: Indicates that the procedure need not check for any of the default ID variables in the Network data set; if this option is in effect, only the variables specified in the ID= option are displayed within each node.

arguments.name: NODETRACK
arguments.description: Specifies that the arcs can be routed along potential node positions if there is a clear horizontal track to the left of the successor (or _TO_) node. This is the default option.

arguments.name: NOLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the labels. By default, the procedure uses the first three letters of the variable name to label all the variables that are displayed within each node of the network. The only exception is the variable that is identified by the ACTIVITY= option.

arguments.name: NONDP
arguments.description: Uses a simple heuristic to connect the nodes. The default mode of routing is NONDP, unless the HTRACKS= or VTRACKS= option (or both) are specified and set to a number that is less than the maximum number of successors. The NONDP option is faster than the DP option.

arguments.name: NONODETRACK
arguments.description: Blocks the horizontal track along potential node positions. This option may lead to more turns in some of the arcs. The default is NODETRACK.

arguments.name: NOPAGENUMBER
arguments.description: Suppresses the page numbers that are displayed in the top right corner of each page of a multipage network diagram.

arguments.name: NOREPEATAXIS
arguments.description: Displays the time axis only on the top of the chart and not on every page. This option is useful if the different pages are to be glued together to form a complete diagram. This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: NOTIMEAXIS
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of the time axis and its labels. Note that the nodes are still placed according to the time scale, but no axis is drawn. This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: NOVCENTER
arguments.description: Draws the network diagram just below the titles without centering in the vertical direction.

arguments.name: NOZONELABEL
arguments.description: Omits the zone labeling and the dividing lines. The network is still divided into zones based on the ZONE variable, but there is no demarcation or labeling corresponding to the zones.

arguments.name: NXNODES=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of nodes that should be displayed horizontally across each page of the network diagram.

arguments.name: NYNODES
arguments.description: Specifies the number of nodes that should be displayed vertically across each page of the network diagram.

arguments.name: PAGENUMBER
arguments.description: Numbers the pages of the network diagram on the top right-hand corner of the page if the diagram exceeds one page. The numbering scheme is from left to right, bottom to top (unless the REVERSEY option is specified).

arguments.name: PAGES=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of pages to be used for the network diagram in graphics and line-printer modes. The default value is 100.

arguments.name: PATTERN=
arguments.description: Specifies an integer-valued variable in the Network data set that identifies the color number for each node of the network.

arguments.name: PCOMPRESS
arguments.description: Draws the network diagram on one physical page.

arguments.name: QUITMISSINGALIGN
arguments.description: Stops processing if the ALIGN= variable has any missing values. By default, the procedure tries to fill in missing values using the topological order of the network. This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: RECTILINEAR
arguments.description: Draws arcs with rectangular corners. By default, the procedure uses rounded turning points and rounded arc merges in graphics mode.

arguments.name: REFBREAK
arguments.description: Shows breaks in the time axis by drawing a zigzag line down the diagram just before the tick mark at the break. This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: REFCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the reference character used for drawing reference lines. The default value is "|". This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: RESTRICTSEARCH
arguments.description: Restricts the scope of the arc layout algorithm by restricting the area of search for the arc layout when the DP option is in effect; this is useful in reducing the computational complexity of the dynamic programming algorithm.

arguments.name: REVERSEY
arguments.description: Reverses the order in which the pages are drawn. By default, the pages are ordered from bottom to top in the graphics mode. This option orders them from top to bottom.

arguments.name: ROTATE
arguments.description: Rotates the network diagram to change the orientation of the network to be from top to bottom instead of from left to right.

arguments.name: ROTATETEXT
arguments.description: Rotates the text within the nodes by 90 degrees.

arguments.name: SEPARATEARCS
arguments.description: Separates the arcs to follow distinct tracks.

arguments.name: SEPARATESONS
arguments.description: Separates the children (immediate successors) of a given node by adding an extra space in the center whenever it is needed to enable the node to be positioned at integral (x,y) coordinates.

arguments.name: SHOWBREAK
arguments.description: Shows breaks in the time axis by drawing a jagged break in the time axis line just before the tick mark corresponding to the break. This option is valid only for time-scaled network diagrams.

arguments.name: SHOWSTATUS
arguments.description: Uses the variable STATUS (if it exists) in the Network data set to determine if an activity is in-progress or completed.

arguments.name: SPANNINGTREE
arguments.description: Uses a spanning tree to place the nodes in the network. This method typically results in a wider layout than the default. However, for networks that have totally disjoint pieces, this option separates the network into connected components (or disjoint trees).

arguments.name: SUCCESSOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the variables in the Network data set that name all the immediate successors of the node specified by the ACTIVITY variable.

arguments.name: TIMESCALE
arguments.description: Indicates that the network is to be drawn using a time axis for placing the nodes.

arguments.name: TREELAYOUT
arguments.description: Requests the procedure to draw the network as a tree if the network is indeed a tree (that is, all the nodes have at most one immediate predecessor). The option is ignored if the network does not have a tree structure.

arguments.name: USEFORMAT
arguments.description: Indicates that the explicit format of the ALIGN= variable is to be used instead of the default format based on the MININTERVAL= option.

arguments.name: VMARGIN=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of a vertical margin (in number of character cell positions) for the network. The default width is 1.

arguments.name: VPAGES
arguments.description: Specifies that the network diagram is to be produced using v vertical pages.

arguments.name: VTRACKS=
arguments.description: Controls the number of arcs that are drawn vertically through the space between two adjacent nodes. A default value is based on the maximum number of successors of any node.

arguments.name: WEB=
arguments.description: Specifies the character variable in the Network data set that identifies an HTML page for each activity.

arguments.name: XBETWEEN=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal distance (in character cell positions) between two adjacent nodes. The value for this option must be at least 3; the default value is 5.

arguments.name: YBETWEEN=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical distance (in character cell positions) between two adjacent nodes. The value for this option must be at least 3; the default value is 5.

arguments.name: ZONE=
arguments.description: Names the variable in the Network data set used to separate the network diagram into zones.

arguments.name: ZONELABEL
arguments.description: Labels the different zones and draws dividing lines between two consecutive zones. This is the default behavior; to omit the labels and the dividing lines, use the NOZONELABEL option.

arguments.name: ZONEPAT
arguments.description: Indicates that if a PATTERN variable is not specified or is missing and if a ZONE= variable is present, then the node colors are based on the value of the ZONE= variable.

arguments.name: ZONESPACE
arguments.description: Draws the network with an extra row between two consecutive zones.
